name: Stripling Brothers

name: Janus [GB]
comments: British group who recorded their first and, for many years, only album "Gravedigger" in Germany in 1972. Founder member Colin Orr revived the name in 1990 and has since released several more albums.

name: Git Gone
comments: Austin, Texas-based rockabilly band. Members: Jim Stringer - guitar, lead vocal; Sharon Ward - bass, lead vocal; Lee Potter - drums

name: Deborah Brown

name: Catherine Ashton-Smith

name: Miss Platnum
comments: Romanian-German rapper, singer, songwriter and musician, born in Timișoara, Romania, and often working with Reggae/Hip Hop crossover artists. On her first releases just called Platnum.

name: Yasha
comments: Berlin born and based rapper/singer. He started his career in the HipHop quartet Moabeat.

name: Bill Tonsaker
aliases: Bill Tonsaker and The Kitsilano Cowboys
comments: Canadian trucker, heavy equipment instructor and country music singer/guitarist.

name: Nick Phillips
comments: Jazz trumpeter, songwriter, arranger and producer.

name: Jeff Chambers
comments: Jazz double bassist from the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Anna Puu
comments: Pop singer Season 4 runner-up of the Finnish edition of Idols

name: Nancy Reed [US2]
comments: Vocalist and bassist originally from Brooklyn, New York

name: Boogieman
comments: Rapper, producer, remixer, recording and mixing-engineer, from Reinbek based in Berlin and Hamburg.

name: Culcha Candela
comments: Dancehall, reggae and hip hop act from Berlin.

name: Björn Warns
comments: HipHop musician and performer. Also known as Schiffmeister and Björn Beton.

name: Boris Lauterbach
comments: HipHop artist, composer and producer. In Fettes Brot known as König Boris but also using a couple of other names.

name: Martin Schrader
comments: HipHop musician, composer and producer. In Fettes Brot known as Doktor Renz but also using various other aliases.

name: Ute Freudenberg

name: Frank Farrell [GB]
comments: Rock bassist, vocalist and songwriter born in Birmingham, England

name: Gus Viseur
aliases: Gus Viseur et son ensemble musette

name: Freddie Wacker
aliases: Freddie Wacker and His Windy City Seven
comments: Principally a businessman, Wacker, who was the grandson of Charles H. Wacker, for whom Wacker Drive in Chicago is named,  was also a jazz drummer who led his own groups in Chicago.

name: The Serenaders [US1]
comments: R&B vocal group from Detroit. Members included Members Noah Howell [baritone/tenor], Norman Thrasher [baritone], Isaac "Ike" Reese [bass] and Thearon "T-Man" Hill [tenor]. In addition to recording as the Serenaders, this group recorded as the Musketeers, the Royals and the Royal Jokers.

name: Wierba and Schmidt Quintet
aliases: Wierba and Schmidt Quintet feat. Piotr Baron
comments: Jazz group. It is actually a quartet with different guest fifth members.

name: Lutz Häfner
comments: Jazz saxophonist, composer and arranger born in Nuremberg.

name: Lou Caputo
aliases: Lou Caputo & The Not So Big Band

name: Leon Selph
aliases: Leon Selph and His Blue Ridge Playboys
comments: Selph was taught violin beginning at age seven and was a member of the Houston Youth Symphony at age 14.  At age 17, he was hired by W. Lee O'Daniel to play fiddle with the Light Crust Doughboys, although a major duty was teaching the other band members a new song every week for the Doughboys' radio show as most of the band musicians could not read music.  In this capacity, Bob Wills was one of his students.  Selph later joined Wills as one of the Texas Playboys before starting his own group, The Blue Ridge Playboys.  From the mid-1930s until the outbreak of World War II, The Blue Ridge Playboys had a radio program on KPRC in Houston. After World War II, Selph began a long career with the Houston Fire Department, although he continued to run a band.  When he retired from the fire department in 1972, he toured the Soviet Union and Europe as a cultural ambassador for the U.S. State Department.  He is regarded as one of the pioneers of  honky-tonk music and was inducted into the Texas Western Swing Hall of Fame in 1996.

name: Eric Faulkner
comments: Guitarist, songwriter and singer, born in Edinburgh, Scotland

name: Stuart Wood
comments: Guitarist and bassist, born in Edinburgh, Scotland

name: Stan Laurel
comments: English comic actor, writer and film director, who was part of the comedy duo Laurel and Hardy. He appeared with his comedy partner Oliver Hardy in 107 short films, feature films, and cameo roles. In 1961 Laurel was given a Lifetime Achievement Academy Award for his pioneering work in comedy. He has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 7021 Hollywood Blvd. Laurel and Hardy ranked top among best double acts and seventh overall in a 2005 UK poll to find the Comedians' Comedian.

name: Oliver Hardy
comments: American comic actor famous as one half of Laurel and Hardy. Laurel and Hardy ranked top among best double acts and seventh overall in a 2005 UK poll to find the Comedians' Comedian.

name: Charlie McClendon
comments: Rhythm & Blues and gospel singer from Norfolk, Virginia.

name: The Red Dogs
comments: Nine-piece multi-instrument show company from Lawrence, Kansas

name: Russell Stone
comments: Singer-songwriter, composer, psychotherapist, counselor and teacher

name: Ari "Dr. Snout" Ahvonen
aliases: Dr. Snout & His Hogs of Rhythm
comments: R&B jump blues vocalist from Finland.

name: Robert Lucas de Pearsall
comments: Lawyer and composer (particularly of vocal works)

name: Herbie Kay
comments: Although born in Dallas, Texas, Kay led a regional dance band based in Chicago.  Dorothy Lamour was discovered at a talent show by Kay who hired Lamour as his orchestra's female singer.  They were thereafter briefly married; however, the marriage ended because Lamour moved to Hollywood to work in films.

name: Dave King [GB]
comments: English comedian, actor and vocalist, who is best remembered for screen roles such as the corrupt policeman Parky in the British gangster film "The Long Good Friday" (1980) and Clifford Duckworth in the soap opera "Coronation Street"

name: Wah!

name: The Wrags

name: Cass Daley
comments: Radio, television and film actress, singer, and comedienne.

name: Our Kid
comments: Vocal group discovered by the ITV show, New Faces and considered a One Hit Wonder.

name: Billy Kinsley
comments: Bassist, singer and songwriter from Liverpool.

name: Liverpool Express
comments: Pop / rock quartet formed in 1975. Their greatest success was found in South America where three of their singles ("You Are My Love", "Every Man Must Have a Dream", and "Dreamin'") reached # 1 in the charts of various countries.

name: Jim Hurt

name: Duncker/Oerding Trio

name: Dag Frøland
comments: Comedian, revue artist, singer and lyricist

name: Reggie Young
comments: Session lead guitarist, whose career spanned seven decades

name: µ-Ziq
comments: Michael Robert Paradinas (born 26 September 1971, in Wimbledon, United Kingdom), who works primarily under the name μ-Ziq (pronounced "music") is an English musician in the field of electronic music. He runs the Planet Mu label.

name: Billy Jack Wills
aliases: Billy Jack Wills and His Western Swing Band
comments: Western swing performer, songwriter and band leader

name: Powder Blues
comments: Blues rock band formed in the 1970s in Vancouver.

name: Ewert Ljusberg

name: Ian Simpson
comments: Musician (guitar, banjo) and singer from Western Australia.

name: Reginald "Sonny" Burke

name: Steve Varner
comments: Jazz acoustic and electric bassist based in New Jersey.

name: Boyd Heath
comments: Western style singer of Native American and Dutch ancestry. He was also a comical emcee . He appeared regularly on several television shows including "The Saturday Night Jamboree" on WNBT (New York City) and a children's show, "Ranger Ranch Roundup."

name: Robert Sauer

name: Lee Sheriden

name: T-Connection

The group consisted of the band leader Theophilus Coakley, Kirkwood Coakley on bass and drums, David Mackey on guitar, and Anthony Flowers on drums and percussion. They broke up in the early 80s.

name: Country Jim

name: John Bishop [US2]
comments: Jazz- blues - soul guitarist and songwriter

name: Henk Wijngaard
comments: Singer, whose mother was a refugee from France and his fatherwas a Canadian allied soldier. He was initially employed as a truck driver and in 1978 he had his breakthrough hit with the self-penned song "Met de vlam in de pijp". After this followed 20 further Dutch Top 40 hits, many on the themes of truck driving.

aliases: John Guliak and The Lougan Brothers

name: Ian Cussick
comments: Singer and songwriter from Dundee, Scotland. Spent most of his career in Germany.

name: Cobra
comments: Short-lived melodic hard rock band from Memphis, Tennessee

name: Lu Ann Simms
comments: Singer and actress. She first gained notice from her appearances as a regular on the television version of "The Arthur Godfrey Show".

name: Elizabeth Harwood
comments: Operatic soprano. She sang in a wide range of subgenres, working with D'Oyly Carte to performing modern opera. She was a prolific recording artist.

name: Diana Landor
comments: Vocalist with credits in stage musicals and cabaret.

name: Rodne Brown
comments: Tenor with credits in musicals and folk music.

name: Ruth Ann Swenson
comments: Operatic soprano. She has made many international appearances including ones at the Metropolitan and Covent Garden.

name: Hal Hackett
comments: Actor and singer born in Sleepy Eye, Minnesota

name: Carolina Moon
comments: Jazz and world music vocalist now based in New Zealand.

name: Stéphane Spira
comments: Jazz saxophonist now based in the US.

name: Alain Cupper
comments: Jazz baritone saxophonist born in Brussels

name: Colin Sheen
comments: Trombonist with a multitude of credits in television and movie music

name: Smoky Dawson
aliases: Smoky Dawson with His Rocky Canyon Boys
comments: Smoky Dawson was a legendary Australian country music and western performer. He was a rodeo performer and from 1952 until the early 1960s he hosted "The Adventures of Smoky Dawson" radio show.

name: The Upper 5th
comments: Mod-influenced power pop / rhythm & soul band from Birmingham. Active: 1997-2001 and 2007-2012.

name: Taylor Ware
comments: Singer and yodeler from Tennessee. In 2003 she was featured in a Yahoo commercial after winning $10,000 in the Yahoo! Yodel Challenge. In 2006 she placed second in the "America's Got Talent" television show.

name: Ranger Doug
comments: Musician, historian, writer, sondwriter and performer. As Ranger Doug, the Idol of American Youth and Governor of the Great State of Rhythm, he founded the western group, Riders in the Sky in 1977.

name: Famous Lashua
aliases: Famous Lashaway and the Tumbleweed Trio

name: Ullanda McCullough
comments: Pop/disco/R&B vocalist. Beginning her career as a backing vocalist, she went on to record three solo albums.

name: Niven Miller
comments: Scottish baritone singer from St. Monans, Fife.

name: Georgia Yellow Hammers
comments: Early string band based in Calhoun County in rural Georgia. Members included Bill Chitwood [fiddle], Bud Landress [banjo], Ernest Moody, Phil Reeve, Clyde Evans, Andrew Baxter and Jim Baxter.

name: Cliff Hanley
comments: A journalist, novelist, playwright and broadcaster from Glasgow.

name: Harry Torrani
comments: Harry Torrani was a singer, songwriter, musician and stage entertainer. Many consider him to be the best yodeler to be recorded. From 1932 to 1941 he recorded 50 titles issued on 25 singles. He traveled extensively performing in Europe, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East and America.

name: Tommy Cutrer
aliases: T. Tommy and The Chanter Choir
comments: Country and gospel singer, musician and radio/television personality. He was well-known as an announcer on the Grand Ole Opry and other radio and television programs.

name: Billy John & The Continentals
comments: Garage band from Louisiana. Active in the 1960s.

name: Chris Stapleton
comments: Country, bluegrass, and rock musician and songwriter

name: Joey Sehee
comments: Artist from Los Angeles active in the lounge scene in the 1990s. Sehee left the lounge scene land currently lives in Sante Fe where he established the Green Burial Council , an non-profit organization that "seeks to move the deathcare industry in a more ethical and environmentally sustainable direction."

name: Brother Cleve
aliases: Br. Cleve and His Lush Orchestra
comments: Lounge music keyboardist and producer. Br. Cleve and His Lush Orchestra is his solo project.

name: Wiskey Biscuit
comments: Alt rock band from Los Angeles.

name: Action Figures
comments: Alternative rock band from Fairview, Virginia

name: Dennis Charles
comments: Jazz drummer who specialized in free jazz.

name: Hank Squires
comments: Johannesburg-born rock 'n' roll guitarist, singer and producer.

name: Lulu Belle & Scotty
aliases: Lulu Belle & Scotty and Five String Banjo
Lulu Belle and Scotty and Their Barn Dance Boys
comments: Husband and wife country duo, consisting of Myrtle Eleanor Cooper (December 24, 1913 – February 8, 1999) and Scott Wiseman. They were one of the major country music acts of the 1930s and 1940s dubbed The Sweethearts of Country Music.

name: Dave Johnston
comments: Bluegrass banjo player and songwriter. He was born in Aurora, IL. His first ensemble was a group called Giblet Gravy. Some of the members split off with Dave to form The Bluegrassholes. Dave was eventually drawn to the Boulder, CO, acoustic music scene, forming the Yonder Mountain String Band in 1998.

name: W. Lee O'Daniel
aliases: W. Lee O'Daniel and His Hillbilly Boys
comments: O'Daniel was a conservative Texas Democratic politician who served terms as both Governor of Texas and United States Senator from Texas, immediately preceding Lyndon Johnson.  In fact, O'Daniel defeated Johnson in the 1941 special election in Texas for U.S. Senate. Prior to his political career, O'Daniel worked for Burrus Mills, a flour-milling company, for which he bacame head of advertising.  In this capacity, he hired the musicians who became The Light Crust Doughboys . O'Daniel, himself, wrote songs and sang for the group. After the break-up of The Light Crust Dough Boys, O'Daniel formed another group to promote his own Hillbilly Flour Company.  For a period in the 1930s, O'Daniel hosted a radio show heard throughout Texas and he became "Pappy" McDaniel after an oft repeated phrase heard on the show "pass the biscuits, Pappy". The character Governor Pappy O'Daniel from the 2000 film "O Brother, Where Art Thou?" was loosely based on O'Daniel.

name: Irene Spain
comments: Irene Spain was the staff pianist for Atlanta based radio station WSB. Along with her sister, Mary Lee, and brother, T.P., she was a member of the Jenkins Family singing group organized by her stepfather, Andy Jenkins. They performed on WSB shortly after it went on the air in 1922.

name: Liz Lyndell
comments: Singer, Songwriter, Music Publisher and Producer.

name: Frank Deniz
aliases: Frank Deniz and His Spirits of Rhythm
comments: Black Welsh jazz guitarist and bandleader.

name: Roy Gerson
comments: Performing swing-oriented jazz pianist. He has appeared in several movies as a piano player.

name: Jim Wilson [US1]
comments: Country music radio personality, singer and songwriter from Bowling Green, Kentucky

name: Manuel Gas
aliases: Manolo Gas & The Tinto Band Bang
Manuel Gas y su organo Hammond

name: Zendaya
comments: Actress and singer from Oakland, California

name: Bob Keane
comments: Jazz clarinetist, producer and record company owner. Keane co-founded Keen Records with businessman John Siamas; however, Keane only had an oral agreement with Siamas, and after 'You Send Me' by Sam Cooke was released and became a big hit, Siamas challenged Keane's ownership interest in Keen Records. While litigation with Siamas ensued, Keene formed Del-Fi.

name: The British Paraorchestra
comments: Founded by conductor Charles Hazlewood and television director Claire Whalley in January 2012, The British Paraorchestra is the world’s first professional ensemble of disabled musicians. It is pioneering a global movement to recognise and showcase disabled musicians with extraordinary abilities. Its mission is to end the limitations placed on them, not by their physical ability, but by lack of opportunity.

name: Paralympics GB Athletes
comments: Members from the Great Britain team that had participated in the London 2012 Paralympics.

name: The Kaos Signing Choir for Deaf & Hearing Children
comments: The Kaos Organisation is a youth arts charity based in Haringey, London, established in February 1995.  It raises deaf awareness and promotes inclusion in its workshops, where participants learn to sing and sign, and its productions are sign language interpreted.  The choir includes children from four to eighteen.

name: Joe Mazzone
comments: Airline pilot and singer who was best known for singing in barbershop harmony groups

name: Rowena Muldavin
comments: Songwriter and writer of the "My Kind of Country" blog for many years.

name: Terrell Prude
comments: Professional performing pianist and organist now based in Las Vegas.

name: JR Williams
comments: Country music performer from Echuca, Victoria.

name: Offering [US]
comments: Acoustic rock/pop band based in Richmond, Virginia

name: Jasper Forks
comments: House music producer, songwriter and DJ.

name: R.H. Cornelius
comments: Gospel music composer, publisher and singer born in Alabama. In the 1890s he moved to Texas where he became well-known as a music educator.

name: James Rowe
comments: English-born gospel songwriter who lived in New York.  Prolific writer of gospel verse with more than 9,000 published hymns, poems, recitations, and other works.

name: Ezra Carter
comments: First husband of Maybelle Carter and commonly known as Eck Carter, he managed the famous Carter Family in the 1940s and 1950s.  He was also credited as a songwriter.

name: Terence Young
comments: Smooth jazz guitarist from South Carolina

name: Andrew David Sotomayor
comments: Broadway musical director, composer, pianist and singer

name: Teresa Fischer
comments: Cabaret singer with folk, country, and Broadway influences

name: Cammie Ward
comments: Singer-songwriter living in the Charlotte, North Carolina, area.

name: The Dixiebelles
comments: Studio vocal group made up of members of The Anita Kerr Singers. A different trio was used for live performances. The photo is the female soul group from Memphis, Tennessee, U.S.,that use to go out for the live performances.

name: Hjaltalín
comments: Seven-piece pop band with influences ranging from modern indie rock to 60s pop to classical music

name: Carli Muñoz
comments: Puerto Rican-born jazz and rock pianist.

name: Blackie & The Oohoos
comments: Indie pop: Hannes d'Hoine, Alfredo Bravo, Milan Warmoeskerken, Loesje Maieu, Martha Maieu.

name: Damon Black
comments: Politician and songwriter from Bonne Terre, MO.

name: The Simon Kenyatta Troupe
comments: Funk band led by percussionist Kenyatta Simon.

name: Jean-Yves Thibaudet
comments: Pianist. While primarily performing classical music, he has branched out into jazz and playing for movie soundtracks.

name: Monophonics
comments: Psychedelic soul & heavy funk band from San Francisco.

name: Artistry Jazz Group
comments: Mainstream jazz band feat. Hans Backenroth, Jacob Fischer, Jan Lundgren, Johan Löfcrantz, Vivian Buczek

name: Boplicity
comments: Jazz ensemble in the tradition of the larger Miles Davis groups of the late 1940s.

name: Brad Linde
comments: Jazz saxophonist and educator based in Washington, D.C.

name: Mac Robinson
comments: Producer and member of songwriting and production team Fisticuffs

name: Sylvia Bennett
comments: Smooth jazz and pop singer.  Bennett was born in Italy, but moved to Philadelphia as a child.

name: Terry Eldredge
comments: Bluegrass and country music singer-songwriter and musician

name: Pat Burton
comments: Singer, guitarist and fiddle player from Illinois.

name: Patent Pending [US2]
comments: Bluegrass band. Members include Eldred Hill [mandolin, vocals], Leigh Taylor [bass vocals], Rusty Williams [guitar, vocals]. Jim Steptoe [banjo, vocals] and Mike Hartnett [fiddle].

name: Brittany Allyn
comments: Singer-songwriter who performs in a range of styles, including country, jazz, blues, and pop

name: BJ Blue
comments: Singer and songwriter whose music ranges from bluegrass to mainstream country to redneck rock

name: The Monarchs [US1]
comments: Vocal group. Members include Sam Black and Ritchie Burton.

name: Herb & Kay
comments: Herb and Kay Adams were husband and wife from Ohio. Both sang, Kay played guitar and Herb played the violin

name: Andrew Goldstein
comments: Singer-songwriter and record producer, originally from Reston, Virginia

name: MKTO
comments: Musical duo consisting of Malcolm Kelley and Tony Oller.

name: Eyelids
comments: Indie rock band based in Portland, Oregon

name: Peggy Lipton
comments: Actress and former model, best known for her role as Julie Barnes in the TV show "The Mod Squad".

name: Tim Smith [GB]
comments: Singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, music producer and video director

name: Spindlewood
comments: Spindlewood was founded in 1987 as a folk duo consisting of Jesse Rowan (aka Cathleen Moran) and Wayne Collins. By the time their second album was released in 1991, Bob Hefner, Loani McRae and Tony Griffiths were added to the group.

name: Larry Groce
aliases: Larry Groce and The Mountain Stage Band

name: Bags of Rock
comments: A mix of heavy rock and bagpipes.

name: Morty Berk
comments: Songwriter and pianist active in the Philadelphia area during the 1940s and 1950s.

name: Dick Lee [US]
comments: Singer from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He appeared on the Arthur Godfrey national television show,  "Talent Scouts," in 1951. Consequently, he was awarded a record contract with Essex Records of Philadelphia. In 1956 he opened a night club in Cherry Hill, New Jersey and operated it until 1992.

name: Art Ford
comments: Art Ford was a well-known disc jockey based in New York City. He took over the "Milkman's Matinee" radio show in 1942. In 1951 he hosted "The Art Ford Show," a televised musical quiz show with three disc jockeys as panelists. He also hosted the televised "Art Ford's Jazz Party" later in the 1950s.

name: Brian Oberlin
comments: Singer, mandolin player and educator.  Oberlin performs swing, bluegrass, and Italian classical. He is the founder and director of the River of the West Mandolin Camp and the Oregon Mandolin Orchestra.

name: LMC
comments: House music production trio: Cris Nuttall, Lee Monteverde and Matt Cadman.

name: Oregon Mandolin Orchestra
comments: Mandolin orchestra founded in January  2010 by Brian and Elizabeth Oberlin.  The orchestra has approximately thirty members (mandolins, mandolas, mandocellos, and double basses) and performs about eight concerts each year in the Portland area.

name: Gary Ferguson
comments: Bluegrass and Americana singer, songwriter and guitarist.

name: Ida Viper
comments: Western swing and bluegrass band based in Portland, Oregon

name: Caravan Gogh
comments: Band based in Portland, Oregon, that blends acoustic string styles with doses of rock, swing, funk, jazz and mysterioso. The band's original songs range from gypsy waltzes to all out acoustic-rock, from calypso-inspired dance tunes to serene soundscapes.

name: Jeff Cohen
comments: Songwriter, producer and publisher based in Nashville and New York

name: Grasshoppah
comments: Three-piece (sometimes four-piece) band with diverse influences from folk, rock, funk, blues, island, and bluegrass

name: The Sea Nymphs
comments: A side project involving three members of Cardiacs.

name: Whole Lotta Rosies
comments: All female AC/DC Tribute band based in Los Angeles

name: Foxey Lady
comments: All female Jimi Hendrix tribute band based in Los Angeles, California

name: ThundHerStruck
comments: All female AC/DC tribute band based in Los Angeles

name: Cheap Chick
comments: All female Cheap Trick tribute band based in Los Angeles

name: Hell's Belles
comments: All female AC/DC tribute band based in Seattle

name: Mistress of Reality
comments: All female Black Sabbath tribute band based in Los Angeles

name: The Little Dolls
comments: All female Ozzy Osbourne tribute band from Beverly Hills

name: Roger La Rue
aliases: Roger La Rue and His Pals
comments: Rockabilly performer from Massachusetts. By the mid 1950s he was performing while still in high school.

name: Empty Set
comments: Punk band led by Ron Asheton

name: Absolute Zeros
comments: Featuring Evan Gamm, Paul Tascione and Steve Deal.

name: Slobberbone
comments: Alternative country rock band from Denton, Texas. Active from 1992 till 2004.

name: Papa Wemba
country: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
comments: Soukous singer-songwriter. He has been dubbed the "King of Rumba".

name: Vitamin String Quartet
comments: Actually a series of anonymous string quartet constellations consisting of non-credited artists. The project only records cover versions and on some recordings also includes additional musicians. Invented and produced by Los Angeles based CMH Records and mainly releasing on their Vitamin [US] sublabel.

name: Celtic Frost
comments: Heavy metal band from Zürich. Formed in 1981 as Hellhammer , the band became Celtic Frost in 1984 and was active until 1993. It re-formed in 2001 and disbanded following frontman TG Fischer's departure in 2008.

name: Diana Darby
comments: Folk rock singer-songwriter and guitarist based in Tennessee.

name: Roger Nichols
aliases: Roger Nichols & The Small Circle of Friends

name: Pete Jolly
aliases: Pete Jolly & His West Coast Friends
The Pete Jolly Trio and Friends
The Swinging Piano of Pete Jolly
comments: Jazz pianist and accordion player. Jolly also can be heard on movie soundtracks and playing television theme songs.

name: Shango [US1]
comments: A four man, Calypso-type band formed in Los Angeles

name: Buster Brown
comments: Blues and R&B vocalist and multi-instrumentalist, gaining notoriety as a harmonica player early in his career. He went unrecorded commercially until 1959, though he does have two earlier sides recorded for the Library of Congress collection. He is often misidentified as "Wayman Glasco", his manager who bought all of Brown's publishing after Brown's death.

name: Little Willie John
comments: Rhythm & Blues balladeer, successful in the second half of the 1950s. Died in prison after a manslaughter conviction. Inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in 1996.

name: Wade Moore
comments: Rockabilly singer and songwriter of the mid 1950's, who would soon leave music and become a businessman.

name: Dick Penner
comments: Rockabilly singer and songwriter of the mid 1950's, who became an English professor at the University of Tennessee.

name: Big Walter Horton
comments: Influential blues harmonica player and pioneer in the field of amplified harmonica

name: Los Super Ratones
comments: Rock and pop band frpom Mar del Plata.

name: REO Speedwagon
comments: Also features Neil Doughty, founding member and keyboard player

name: Powermad
comments: Thrash metal band from Minneapolis. Formed in 1984.

name: Dolores del Río
personal_name: María de los Dolores Asúnsolo y López Negrete

name: Mabel Wayne
comments: Born in Brooklyn, New York City. Daugher of Louis Wimpfheimer (1861-1935) and Mary Ross (1864-?). Married to  Charles Julian Haas (1884-1968). Studied composition at the New York School of Music. After graduating she toured the Keith and Orpheum vaudeville for three seasons (1921-23) as a singer, dancer and pianist. Composer of popular songs, she was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1972. Her birth year is in dispute, some sources claim it was 1904.

name: John T. Brown
aliases: "Nature Boy" Brown and His Blue Ramblers

name: Babyface
comments: R&B singer, songwriter, producer and label executive

name: L.A. Reid
comments: Songwriter and producer. He was the founder of LaFace Records, and is currently CEO of Island Def Jam Music Group. In 2017, Reid was forced to step down as chairman of Epic Records after multiple allegations of sexual harassment.

name: Sodapop
comments: Male vocalist trio, which had a short lived career. The band was put together by the management office Crea-team. The original members were called Pacey (Pieter Van Keymeulen, born Feb. 28, 1985), Dimi(tri) Van Tomme (born May 9, 1979) and Tys (born Jul. 15, 1985). Tys Hoornaert left the band quite quickly however and was replaced by new member Hans Lambrechts who used to be the frontman of another band called Lunah.

name: Frankie Paul
comments: Dancehall reggae artist. Born blind, he has been dubbed by some 'The Jamaican Stevie Wonder'.

name: Sonny Boy Williamson [US1]
comments: Influential Chicago-Blues harmonica player and singer

name: Pia Zadora
comments: Singer and actress. Just having turned 23, she married billionaire Meshulam Riklis (then 64) in 1977. Riklis enabled her way to a music and movie career, a. o. by financing the duet When the Rain Begins to Fall with Jermaine Jackson , which became a hit in many countries, and the movie "Butterfly".

name: Cab Calloway
aliases: Cab Calloway and His Cab Jivers
Cab Calloway and His Cotton Club Orchestra
comments: Singer and bandleader.  Calloway also appeared in many films.

name: Rube Bloom
aliases: Rube Bloom and His Bayou Boys
comments: Composer; also choreographer, pianist, bandleader, and singer. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1982.

name: Will Marion Cook
comments: Violinist, choral director and composer, best known for his popular songs and Broadway musicals.

name: Donald Heywood
comments: Trinidad-born songwriter, composer, writer and director

name: Johnny Jam
comments: Pop music songwriter, musician and producer

name: Electric Chairs [GB2]
comments: Duo based in Bristol, consisting of Jimmy Bergin and Alan Miles.

name: Zebrahead
comments: Punk rock band from Orange County, California, founded in 1996.

name: Paul Desmond
comments: Jazz alto saxophonist and composer.  Considered part of the West Coast "cool school" of jazz.

name: Brian Cant
comments: Actor, presenter and writer, best known for his work in children's television.

name: Freddie Phillips
comments: Musician and composer, best known for his work on television theme music, particularly children's programmes.

name: Sheila Chandra
comments: English pop singer of Indian descent.

name: 3 Cohens
comments: Jazz combo with three Cohen siblings as core members.

name: Dean Johnson
comments: Jazz double bassist and educator. He was a sideman for Gerry Mulligan for ten years.

name: Gerry Mulligan All-Star Tribute Band
comments: Ensemble made up of past Mulligan sidemen and collaborators.

name: Jason Pegg
comments: Vocalist, guitarist and keyboard player, best known as the frontman of Brighton indie band Clearlake.

name: Robert White [GB]
comments: Multi-instrumentalist and producer, who began his musical career in the south London free festival scene of the 1980s. In 1990 White joined the hotly tipped Levitation. White was the band’s keyboard player, third guitarist and main harmony singer: within its collective songwriting format, he also wrote a high proportion of the band’s material.

name: Marie Dubas
comments: Music-hall singer and actress, who was Edith Piaf's idol

name: The Rockarounds
comments: Bass Guitar – Tommy Cassemar Drums, Percussion – Ingemar Dunker Guitar, Vocals, Piano – Jan Oldaeus Saxophone, Vocals – Micke Finell

name: Willie Lewis [US2]
comments: Rockabilly performer from Denver, Colorado. He founded the Rock-A-Billy Record Company in the late 1970s.

name: Woody Patty
comments: Songwriter, singer, guitarist and teacher from Oklahoma

name: Bic Hayes
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, principally a guitarist, and singer-songwriter active in the UK psychedelic post-punk scene.

name: Celeste Krenz
comments: Singer, songwriter and musician from North Dakota.

name: Ester Brohus
comments: Country, rock and folk singer, songwriter and guitarist.

name: Bug Prentice
comments: A three-piece avant-punk band based between Oxford and London.

name: Spiritwo
comments: A London-based theatrical electro rock band.

name: Eric Bentley
comments: Playwright and theatre critic, Bentley was born in the UK but became a US citizen in 1948. He is a renowned expert on Berthold Brecht, having translated and performed many of Brecht's works. 42 of those were collected in his "Brecht-Eisler Song Book" (published in 1967).

name: Art Bears
comments: Art-rock group formed at the end of the 1970s from the remnants of Henry Cow .

name: Tangarine
comments: Folk music duo consisting of identical twin brothers

name: The Caliban Quartet
comments: Toronto-based bassoon quartet founded in 1993 that plays chamber music from a wide range of genres

name: Calling Levi
comments: Traveling, vocal ministry comprising two sisters and their husbands

name: Ginny Gibson
comments: Ginny Gibson was a singer, radio and television performer from Rochester, New York.   She is not the same person as Virginia Gibson, a dancer and actress from St. Louis who appeared in the film, "Seven Brides for Seven Brothers.:"

name: Sue Richards
comments: Country and gospel singer and songwriter

name: Saturday Night Band
comments: Concept band for the disco label, Prelude Records

name: Knifeworld
comments: Originally a solo project of Cardiacs guitarist Kavus Torabi, Knifeworld became a full band in summer 2009.

name: Harry Bliek
comments: Started his career in 1959, mainly singing cover versions, when he was a VARA employee. Born in Hilversum.

name: Casablanca Steel Orchestra
comments: Steel band active in the 1940s and 1950s. Also known as "The Casablanca Steel Band."

name: John Wallace
comments: Bass player and vocalist, best known as a member of the Harry Chapin band. He was the only band member that was with Chapin during his entire solo music career (1971-1981).

name: Tom Chapin
comments: Folk singer and songwriter, best known for his children's music

name: Hans Engelmann
comments: Composer born in Berlin and moved to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania while in his late teens.

name: Edison Symphony Orchestra
comments: House Orchestra of the Edison record label. In 1908 it was renamed to American Symphony Orchestra.

name: Heidi Newfield
comments: Country music singer, rhythm guitarist and harmonica player

name: Steve Chapin
comments: Singer, who performed with Harry Chapin for much of his solo career

name: Eddie Thomas [US1]
comments: Composer of popular and classical music, including opera.  Thomas also is a guitarist and record producer.

name: Steve Thompson [US]
comments: Flute player based in the Seattle area

name: Billy Rankin
comments: Scottish guitarist and rock musician active in the 1980s and 1990s

name: Ella Fitzgerald
aliases: Ella Fitzgerald and Her Famous Orchestra
Ella Fitzgerald and Her Rhythm Makers
Ella Fitzgerald and Her Savoy Eight
Ella Fitzgerald and Her Special Servers

name: Midge Ure
comments: Scottish guitarist, keyboard player, singer, and songwriter

name: Willis Jackson
comments: Jazz, soul jazz, and R&B tenor saxophonist

name: Ramsey Lewis
aliases: Lem Winchester and The Ramsey Lewis Trio
Ramsey Lewis and The Gentlemen of Jazz
Ramsey Lewis and His Gentlemen of Swing

name: John Mayall
aliases: John Mayall and The Blues Breakers
comments: Blues and rock musician, songwriter and producer

name: Gérard Gustin
aliases: Monsieur Hubert Clavecin et ses rythmes
Mr. Hubert Clavecin et ses rythmes

name: Ray Nance
comments: Trumpet player, violinist and singer.  Nance is best known for his long association with the Duke Ellington Orchestra as a featured performer.

name: Pérez Prado
aliases: Dámaso Pérez Prado y su orquesta
Members of The Perez Prado Orchestra
Pérez Prado "El Rey del Mambo" y Los Cuatro Diablos
Pérez Prado "El Rey del Mambo" y su orquesta
Perez Prado et la sua Orchestra
comments: Cuban bandleader, singer, organist, pianist and composer, who also made brief appearances in films. He is often referred to as the "King of the Mambo".

name: Howard Roberts
comments: Jazz guitarist, educator, session musician and producer

name: Polecats
comments: Rockabilly band formed in north London.

name: 46bliss
comments: Synth-pop, dance and alternative rock group

name: Toninho Horta
comments: Guitarist, composer, arranger, singer, a lifelong friend and occasional collaborator of Milton Nascimento

name: Elliot Humberto Kavee
comments: Drummer/cellist  and Tony Award-winning actor and writer

name: Áine Minogue
comments: Harpist, singer, arranger and composer based in Boston, Massachusetts

name: Paul Schwartz
comments: Music producer, composer, arranger, conductor and pianist. His music is mainly in a neo-classical style and is often classified as New Age.

name: Joemy Wilson
comments: A hammered dulcimer player from New Haven, Connecticut.

name: The Nerves
comments: Mid-1970s power pop trio, based in Los Angeles. All three members composed songs and sang.

name: The Beatstalkers
comments: Glasgow beat group, sometimes called "The Scottish Beatles"

name: Spahn Ranch
comments: Industrial dance band formed in Los Angeles.

name: T. Rex
comments: Acoustic act turned superstar glam rock boogie duo, a foursome at some times

name: Randy & The Rainbows
comments: Doo-wop group from New York City.

name: The Marvelettes
comments: Girl group, part of the Motown roster

name: Chris Barber
aliases: Chris Barber's Jazz and Blues Band
Chris Barber's New Orleans Jazz Band
comments: Jazz trombonist from Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire. Before leading his own band, he was a member of Ken Colyer 's Jazzmen (1953-54).

name: Louie Louie
comments: Dance pop singer, songwriter, and dancer

name: Lisa Lauren
comments: Pop jazz vocalist based in Evanston, Illinois

name: Me First and The Gimme Gimmes
Matt Monro
comments: Vocalist, who became one of the most popular entertainers on the international music scene during the 1950s and 1970s

name: George Van Eps
comments: Swing and mainstream jazz guitarist.  Van Eps is sometimes called "the father of the seven string guitar".

name: Anything Box
comments: Formed by Claude Strilio with two friends, Dania Morales and Paul Rijnders, originally from Paterson, New Jersey, and now based in Long Beach, California. The New Jersey trio took their name from the title of a book of short stories. The act signed with Epic and released their debut album, Peace, in 1990,

name: Canadian Brass
comments: Brass quintet that plays in a variety of styles, but principally classical and jazz music

name: Echo & The Bunnymen
comments: Rock band formed in Liverpool. Their dark, guitar-centered music was infused with a psychedelic undercurrent.

name: Ferrante & Teicher
aliases: Ferrante & Teicher with Their Orch. & Chorus
comments: Piano duo (Arthur) Ferrante & (Louis) Teicher were one of the best-selling easy listening acts of the 1960s, offering light arrangements of easily recognizable classical pieces, movie soundtrack themes and show tunes.

name: Beppe Gambetta
comments: Acoustic guitarist, singer, composer, teacher, author, and researcher of traditional music and instruments. Born in Genova, Liguria and father of Filippo Gambetta (button accordion player).

name: Leo Diamond
aliases: Leo Diamond His Harmonica & His Orchestra
Leo Diamond His Harmonica and Orchestra
comments: Harmonica player, songwriter, composer, orchestra leader and arranger

name: Shane McAnally
comments: Country music singer, songwriter and producer

name: Rudolf Tomsits
comments: Jazz trumpet and flugelhorn player and musical director.

name: Bross Townsend
comments: Jazz and blues pianist. Townsend became blind in the mid-1990s but continued to perform.

name: Fayssoux
comments: Country music singer, guitarist and sometimes percussionist. Fayssoux sings her own compositions as well as traditional folk songs, old-time gospel, contemporary country-rock and love ballads and she has been described by Emmylou Harris as one of her favorite singers.

name: Storefront Congregation
comments: Louisville-based band known for their tight harmonies, fast picking, smooth sounds, and gritty rhythms.

name: Larry Marks
comments: Pop singer, songwriter, producer and conductor

name: The Airmen of Note
aliases: The United States Air Force Airmen of Note
comments: The United States Air Force jazz big band

name: The Bob Lauder Band
comments: This band describes its music as a mix of "Americana, alt country, folk-rock, grunge grass, roots and snake oil music."

name: Stars in Battledress
comments: Duo of brothers Richard and James Larcombe.

name: Gretchen Parlato
comments: Jazz and world music vocalist from Los Angeles

name: Phil Alvin
comments: Guitarist and singer from Downey, CA. He is the older brother of Dave Alvin, and was the front man and lead singer of The Blasters. Phil Alvin holds a degree in mathematics which he earned after his music career with The Blasters.

name: Chubby Jackson
aliases: Chubby Jackson and His Fifth Dimensional Jazzgroup

name: Sarah Measures
comments: Singer and a player of clarinet, flute and saxophone.

name: Athena Reich
comments: Canadian-born alt rock singer-songwriter, pianist and actress. She has gained notoriety as a celebrity impersonator, most notably as Lady Gaga.

name: Guido Mineo
comments: Singer-guitarist and songwriter from Mutovun. From the mid-1980s to the early 1990s, he lived in Germany, where he was a member of some bands and also active as a sound engineer and producer.

name: Spratleys Japs
comments: A psychedelic rock band formed by Cardiacs leader Tim Smith with his then girlfriend Joanne Spratley.

name: Oceansize
comments: Rock band from Manchester; formed in 1998, split in 2011.

name: Len Wilton
aliases: Len Wilton and The New Rhythm Boys

name: Naked Highway
comments: Synth-pop project led by singer-songwriter-producer Sy Boccari, featuring David Lee Rotten and an array of non-permanent members.

name: Laneslide
comments: Melodic hard rock band led by singer Frank Vestry.

name: DJ Blackskin
comments: Hip hop/R&B producer and DJ based in Kassel.

name: The Gasman
comments: An electronic music artist from Portsmouth.

name: Beezy Coleman
comments: A longtime guitarist and backing vocalist for reggae and hip hop artists, Coleman has recently emerged as a solo artist.

name: Eric Reed
comments: Jazz pianist and composer.  Reed has also composed and arranged music for film, television and commercials.

name: Sol Gubin
comments: Drummer.  Gubin kept time for all kinds of music, including jazz,  rhythm and blues, pop and standard vocal music.

name: Mary Carolyn Davies
comments: Mary Carolyn Davies was a poet and short story writer.

name: Matt Slocum
comments: Alt. rock / christian rock singer and guitarist.

name: Rita Springer
comments: Christian music singer-songwriter based in North Carolina.

name: The Spectres [GB1]
comments: Short-lived post-punk band which released two singles

name: Jon Poole
comments: Multi-instrumentalist and singer-songwriter, who plays with several rock bands in various roles.

name: Warren Schein
comments: Stage actor and television and radio actor and voice-over artist

name: Timo Tervo
comments: Pop singer from Jokioinen in the south-west of Finland who began his singing career by forming a band while still at school.

name: Peter Somerville
comments: Bluegrass musician (banjo, dobro, guitar and fiddle) based in Melbourne.

name: Pete Denahy
comments: Country and bluegrass musician and comedian from Yackandandah.

name: Carolyn Martin
comments: Western swing vocalist and guitarist born in Texas, worked in Nashville for some years, and moved several years ago to Indiana.

name: Tia Blake
comments: American folk singer who recorded an album when she was a teenager living  in France

name: Ronald Miller [US2]
comments: Rhythm & blues composer and guitarist, often associated with songwriter Don Covay

name: Soirée
comments: Disco studio group. A project of and led by songwriter and producer Billy Jackson, who assembled a group of studio musicians and vocalists to record discofied classic pop and soul standards. Among the vocalists used were Luther Vandross, Ron Richardson, Kleeer’s Norman Durham, Woody Cunningham, Sharon Redd, Jocelyn Brown and Melvin Sparks. Under the Soirée name one album and one single was released.

name: Kentucky Memories
comments: String band from Eastern Kentucky. It plays primarily old-time and traditional music.

name: Victor Dance Orchestra
comments: House orchestra for the Victor record label.

name: Henry Gilliland
comments: Fiddler. His recording in the database is considered to be the first recorded performance of American traditional music by a traditional artist.

name: The New Coon Creek Girls
aliases: The New Coon Creek Girls featuring Dale Ann Bradley
comments: Bluegrass band, a revival of the 1930s originals

name: Laura Repo
comments: Folk music singer-songwriter, guitarist and actress.

name: Susquehanna Travellers
comments: String band that plays traditional 19th Century music. It often makes appearances at Civil War re-enactments.

name: NDR Bigband
comments: A big band that emerged from the Radio-Tanzorchester Hamburg, which is the national broadcaster of radio and television in northern Germany.  The NDR Bigband is the house band for the broadcaster.

name: Trent Gardner
comments: Prog rock/prog metal keyboardist, trombonist and singer.

name: Wayne Gardner
comments: Prog rock bassist and guitarist.  Gardner committed suicide by firearm.

name: Dik Fraser
comments: Songwriting collaborator with Emerson, Lake and Palmer while working for them as a roadie.

name: Gypsy Jazz Caravan
comments: Instrumental gypsy jazz trio based out of Madison, Wisconsin. Primarily influenced by the legendary Gypsy guitarist Django Reinhardt.

name: Jim Connor
comments: Writer, composer, and musician. Connor is a longtime friend and member of John Denver 's band.

name: Bobby Schiff
comments: Composer, arranger, conductor, pianist, and producer

name: Mark Ryan
comments: Singer-actor and voice actor. He has had roles in the West End and in opera.

name: Mortician
comments: Horror glorifying death metal band from New York

name: Nashi Young Cho
aliases: NYC Nashi Young Cho Jazz Quartett
comments: Vocalist and bandleader based in Hanau

name: Kiki and Herb
comments: Comedy cabaret duo of Justin Bond and Kenny Mellman.

name: Njelle Hamilton
comments: Singer, songwriter and associate professor in the English and African American and African Studies departments at the University of Virginia

name: Young Lions [GB]
comments: Session studio reggae / ska band with only known release

name: Idit Shner
comments: Saxophonist and jazz educator based in Oregon

name: Jean Stafford
comments: Australian country musician, born  at Latrobe, Tasmania.

name: Damnation Angels
comments: Metal band from Doncaster, South Yorkshire

name: Casualty Friday
comments: Goth rock band from Portland, Oregon.

name: Red Shoes
comments: Country-tinged folk duo from Birmingham, West Midlands, consisting of husband and wife Carolyn and Mark Evans.

name: Inkeri Ketola
comments: Pop singer from Helsinki whose career was brought to a premature halt due to epilepsy.

name: Laila Halme
comments: Pop singer from Jääski in Karelia who represented Finland at the 1963 Eurovision Song Contest with "Muistojeni Laulu".

name: Ritva Simuna
comments: Singer from Luopioinen in south-west Finland.

name: Slim Chance
comments: Band members: Alun Davies, Charlie Hart, Colin Davey, Steve Bingham and Steve Simpson

name: Al Archer
comments: Kevin Archer was named "Al" by Kevin Rowland in their Dexys Midnight Runners times (1978-1981), supposedly because Rowland thought the band too small for two Kevins. Archer left Dexys Midnight Runners and founded The Blue Ox Babes naming himself Kevin Archer again.

name: Clint Mansell
comments: English musician, composer, and former lead singer of the band "Pop Will Eat Itself". After Pop Will Eat Itself disbanded in 1996 Mansell was introduced to film scoring.

name: The Channels [US1]
comments: 1950s doo-wop vocal group from New York City

name: The Trombones Inc.
comments: Jazz group existing only for a one-off recording project: Frank Rosolino - Jimmy Cleveland [US2] - Bob Brookmeyer

name: Marjatta Leppänen
comments: Singer, actress and TV presenter from Helsinki.

name: Julian Bliss
comments: Clarinetist who plays primarily classical and chamber music, but who has also played swing jazz.  Bliss has also designed clarinets.

name: Don Preston
comments: Rock guitarist and vocalist born in Denver, Colorado. He played with Ritchie Valens, The Righteous Brothers, Gene Vincent, Joe Cocker, George Harrison and J.J. Cale among others.

name: Mikko Sipola
comments: Winner of the first season of the The Voice of Finland was Mikko Sipola mentored by rapper Elastinen.

name: Kim Koskinen
comments: Contestant in The Voice of Finland first season

name: Mike Hadreas
comments: Alternative pop singer-songwriter and pianist whose music often explores issues related to sexuality.

name: Fred Lonberg-Holm
comments: A cello player based in Chicago, Lonberg-Holm is probably best known for playing free jazz and improvised music, but he also composes concert works and scores for dance.  In addition, he has many credits as a session musician on rock, pop, and country recordings.

name: Bohuslän Big Band
comments: A modern jazz big band tracing its history to the military band of the Bohus Battalion from the early Nineteenth Century.  From the mid-1950s on, the band developed into one of Sweden’s two fully professional big bands.

name: Patti DeRosa
comments: Guitarist, vocalist and songwriter. Derosa's music is a mix of folk, jazz, blues, and pop-rock.

name: George Coolures
comments: Chief of the local fire department and blues-loving harmonica player and composer from Merced, California, who promoted and managed 'The Merced Blue Notes' and occasionally played with them

name: The Merced Blue Notes
comments: Blues rock band from Merced, California

name: Johnnie Johnson
comments: Blues, jazz and rock 'n' roll pianist, who was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's sideman category in 2001

name: Ryan Buendia
comments: Recording artist, DJ, turntablist, producer, and songwriter.

name: Justin Meldal-Johnsen
comments: Producer, songwriter, bassist, multi-instrumentalist and musical director

name: Sax 4th Avenue
comments: Classical to prog rock saxophone quartet based in Toledo, Ohio.

name: Alan Kaplan
comments: Trombonist Kaplan is a top Los Angeles studio musician who has appeared in recordings in many genres.  He has recorded trombone solos for over 600 cartoons and was a member of the staff bands for the Merv Griffin, Joan Rivers and Star Search television programs.

name: Tommy Banks
comments: Pianist, conductor, arranger and composer, Banks was also a radio personality who hosted the CBC program "The Tommy Banks Show" from 1968 to 1983.  Banks also served in the Canadian Senate from 2000 through 2011 as a member of the Liberal Party.

name: Lewis Bellin
comments: Songwriter born in London, England. In his early twenties he became a citizen of the U.S.

name: Heavy the World
comments: Prog metal band from Baltimore, Maryland

name: The Texas Mavericks
comments: Short-lived Austin, Texas-based rock and roll/rockabilly band

name: Joe Cook [US1]
comments: Cook started his career as an entertainer in vaudeville and was a household name in the United States in the 1920s and 1930s.   He was also a performer in Broadway musicals and was also a radio host and frequent guest on radio programs of others in the 1930s.

name: The Sultans [US]
comments: Short-lived vocal group from Omaha, Nebraska. Active in 1954 as "The Sultans", who recorded several singles for the Duke label, and in 1955 - after a name change - as "The Admirals" on the King label. After the group's breakup both Duke and King issue singles of the band.

name: Flo  Handy
family: 42685[Second Husband - married to him at the time of his death]

name: Wimbledon FC & Supporters
comments: Players and fans of Wimbledon Football Club

name: Fiddle Fever
comments: String band group that played a variety of styles including bluegrass, traditional folk, and Western swing. The quintet's instrumentation included three fiddles, acoustic guitar, and upright bass.

name: Oscar Shaw
comments: Stage and screen actor and singer

name: Dave Mindel
comments: Songwriter, composer and radio jingle writer

name: Jodi Benson
comments: Actress, voice actress, and soprano singer. She is best known for providing both the speaking and the singing voice of Disney's Princess Ariel in The Little Mermaid and its sequels. Benson voiced the character Barbie in the films Toy Story 2 and Toy Story 3 and in the Toy Story toon Hawaiian Vacation. She was named a Disney Legend in 2011.

name: Ensemble Ambrosius
comments: A chamber music group, established in 1995, which plays modern music on baroque instruments.

name: Ria Bartok
comments: German-born pop singer, active as a recording artist in the 1960s

name: Gini Wilson
comments: Jazz pianist and composer from the San Francisco Bay Area

name: Dave Lalama
comments: Jazz / rock keyboardist; a professor of music at Hofstra University

name: Franklyn Baur
comments: Pioneering tenor recording artist born in Brooklyn, New York

name: Don Adams [US]
comments: Country music singer, who besides his solo career frequently worked with George Jones and Johnny Paycheck

name: Bill Green
comments: Traditional country music singer, songwriter and label owner from Texas.

name: Jean Moorhead
comments: Jean Moorhead was a Broadway musical comedy performer. In 1946 she moved to the Atlantic City, New Jersey area to direct a Fred Astaire dancing studio and later opened her own dance studio in Atlantic City. On September 30, 1948 she married Harold Ferrin, musical director of the Miss America pageant.  Shortly before her death she became the talent director for this pageant and director of entertainment for the Hotel Dennis in Atlantic City.

name: Lou Wills, Jr.
comments: Dancer, singer, actor and Broadway performer from Pennsylvania.

name: Willie Phelps
comments: Western actor, country singer, songwriter and guitarist.

name: Beverly Stewart
comments: Songwriter and occasional backup singer on her brother's recordings and in his shows.

name: Will Thompson
comments: Hymn writer, music store owner, and music publishing company owner born in East Liverpool, Ohio

name: World Order
comments: Techno-pop band and dance group, known for their elaborate robotic moves.

name: Johanna
comments: Singer, who released two singles on the Kapp label

name: Karen Collins
comments: Country music singer, musician and songwriter.

name: Milt Raskin
comments: Swing/jazz pianist. After working in several big bands, he went into studio work as a musician and musical director.

name: Stockholm Jazz Trio
comments: Trio started in late 2008, originally to tribute the Oscar Peterson Trio period 1959 to 1964. Later expanding to tunes from other trios, as well. Members: Daniel Tilling (p), Jan Adefelt (b) and Jesper Kviberg (dr)

name: Ceramic Dog
comments: Experimental rock band led by Mark Ribot

name: Kokoo
comments: Trio that plays modern music on traditional Japanese instruments (shakuhachi and koto).

name: Hermetic Science
comments: Prog/jazz/world fusion band from Northern California.

name: Wes Buchanan
comments: Country music and rockabilly singer and guitarist, active as a recording artist in the 1950s and 1960s, and songwriter

name: Nick Esposito
comments: R&B and jazz guitarist.  Esposito was also a guitar maker.

name: Ralph Gari
comments: Multi-instrumental wind player, including flute, oboe, English horn, clarinet and saxophone.  Gari played all kinds of music, recording classical and jazz works.  Gari worked in Las Vegas from 1951 until 1974.  He may be also heard on film soundtracks, such as "A Streetcar Named Desire".  Gari was 63 at the time of his death.

name: Echoes of Swing
comments: Swing quartet featuring saxophone, trumpet, piano and drums

name: Intuition [CH]
comments: Jazz band led by saxophonist Phil Stöckli, with Andreas Zitz, Domenic Landolf, Elmar Frey and Michael Beck

name: Julian Yeo
aliases: Julian Yeo & His Retro Jazz Band
comments: Jazz singer who describes his style as "retro-jazz." Yeo was raised in Australia but made his professional career in New York.

name: Jay Armsworthy
comments: Bluegrass singer and rhythm guitar player

name: Mike Cronic
comments: Singer / guitar player orginally from Athens, GA. Now living in Nashville

name: Ray Dobard
comments: Originally from New Orleans, Ray Dobard moved to California where he opened the Delcro record label in Berkeley in 1953. In 1954 he founded the better known Music City label.

name: The 4 Deuces
comments: Doo wop vocal group from Salinas, California.

name: Omnibus Wind Ensemble
comments: Classical ensemble, partly crossing over to modern genres. Also known as Omnibus kammarblåsare.

name: Blundetto
comments: Soul-reggae musician, originally from Dijon, but now living and working in Paris

name: William Harold
comments: William "Sugar" Harold was a violinist with Wayne King's orchestra.

name: Ed Palermo
comments: Saxophonist, guitarist, composer and arranger mainly performing and recording with his big band

name: Paul Godwin
aliases: Paul Godwin mit seinem Künstler-Ensemble vom Nelson-Theater Berlin

name: Cyrille Aimée
aliases: Cyrille Aimée and The Surreal Band
comments: Jazz singer from Samois-sur-Seine, Fontainebleau. Her father is French and her mother is from the Dominican Republic.
